item.title: 马斯克暗示特斯拉股东将就 xAI 投资进行投票
item.description: 在《华尔街日报》报道 SpaceX 准备向 Grok 聊天机器人开发商注资 20 亿美元后，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）表示，特斯拉公司计划就是否投资 xAI 的问题征求股东意见。【原文：Tesla Inc. plans to poll shareholders on whether to invest in xAI, Elon Musk said after the Wall Street Journal reported SpaceX was prepared to funnel $2 billion into the Grok chatbot developer.】

item.title: 日元交易员在日本大选前重整期权押注
item.description: 期权交易商开始对日本货币进行反向操作，其中一些人担心政治冲击、贸易冲突和美联储预期的变化会推动日元兑美元走低。【原文：Option traders are beginning to flip the script on Japan’s currency with some of them bracing for political shocks, trade flare-ups, and shifting Federal Reserve expectations to push the yen lower against the dollar.】

item.title: 政策鸽派、财政前景黯淡，印尼债券或将进一步上涨
item.description: 印尼央行的鸽派立场和对国家财政政策担忧的缓解，使人们更加期待政府债券将在下半年延续涨势。【原文：Bank Indonesia’s dovish stance and easing concerns over the nation’s fiscal policy are fueling expectation that government bonds will extend their rally into the second half of the year.】

item.title: 新加坡因建筑业和出口业增长强劲而避开衰退
item.description: 新加坡经济在第二季度有所增长，避免了技术性衰退，原因是建筑活动增加以及出口强劲，因为企业寻求提前应对美国提高关税。【原文：Singapore’s economy expanded in the second quarter, avoiding a technical recession on a rise in construction activity and strong exports as businesses seek to front-run higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 新西兰消费放缓加剧经济降温迹象
item.description: 新西兰第二季度零售卡支出下降，这进一步表明，今年年初经济增长的最初冲刺几乎消失殆尽。【原文：New Zealand retail card spending fell in the second quarter, adding to signs that an initial spurt of economic growth early this year has all but disappeared.】

item.title: 特朗普在最后期限前加倍征收关税，黄金上涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布下月起对欧盟和墨西哥征收 30% 的关税后，交易员们权衡了特朗普新的关税威胁，避险需求提振黄金上涨。【原文：Gold gained, bolstered by haven demand as traders weighed fresh tariff threats from President Donald Trump after he declared a 30% rate for the European Union and Mexico effective next month.】

item.title: 印度私人银行在财富热潮中砸重金招揽人才
item.description: 签约奖金、股票期权、高额佣金，甚至是双倍工资；这就是印度经验丰富的私人银行家，有时甚至是经验较少的私人银行家的要求，因为人才争夺战愈演愈烈。【原文：Signing bonuses, stock options, hefty commissions and even the doubling of salaries — that’s what seasoned private bankers, and in some cases less experienced ones, are demanding in India as the fight for talent intensifies.】

item.title: 新加坡落后的首次公开募股市场寄希望于 NTT 的复苏
item.description: 新加坡八年来最大规模的首次公开募股将检验该国的证券交易所是否最终对新上市公司具有吸引力。【原文：Singapore’s biggest initial public offering in eight years will test whether the country’s stock exchange is finally attractive for new listings.】

item.title: 特朗普加强关税威胁，美国期货下跌：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周末宣布从8月1日起对欧盟和墨西哥的商品征收30%的关税后，美国股市期货周一下跌。【原文：US equity futures dropped on Monday following President Donald Trump’s weekend declaration of a 30% tariff on goods from the European Union and Mexico effective Aug. 1.】

item.title: 特朗普在对俄行动前加征关税，石油涨势扩大
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在周末宣布对从欧盟和墨西哥进口的商品征收 30% 的关税，在对俄罗斯发表 "重大声明 "之前，石油连续第二天上涨。【原文：Oil rose a second day as President Donald Trump declared 30% tariffs on imports from the European Union and Mexico over the weekend, ahead of a “major statement” on Russia.】

item.title: 中国经济增长有望超预期 缓解经济刺激压力
item.description: 中国第二季度的经济增长可能略高于政府的全年增长目标，这减轻了中国政府在短期内推出更多刺激措施的压力。【原文：China’s economy likely expanded just above the government’s full-year growth target in the second quarter, easing pressure on Beijing to roll out additional stimulus in the near term.】

item.title: 新关税威胁考验墨西哥 "冷静 "的特朗普态度
item.description: 墨西哥官员对唐纳德-特朗普总统最新的关税威胁大吃一惊，此前他们曾频繁拜访特朗普在华盛顿的高级助手，以说服特朗普他们打击贩毒的努力正在取得成效。【原文：Mexican officials were taken aback by President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threat after paying frequent visits to his top aides in Washington to convince him their efforts to fight drug trafficking were paying off.】

item.title: 在关键的 CPI 数据公布前，债券交易员对美联储 9 月缩表表示怀疑
item.description: 今年大部分时间里，债券投资者几乎都确信，美联储将在 9 月份恢复降息。【原文：For much of this year, bond investors were all but certain that the Federal Reserve would resume cutting interest rates by September.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利警告银行不要发行自己的稳定币
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）警告全球最大的银行不要发行自己的稳定币，这可能会与唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府及其对数字资产的支持发生冲突。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey has warned the world’s largest banks against issuing their own stablecoins, setting up a potential clash with President Donald Trump’s administration and its backing of the digital assets.】

item.title: 默茨称美国征收 30% 关税将对德国工业造成 "核心 "打击
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-默茨（Friedrich Merz）表示，如果在未来几周内无法通过谈判解决贸易冲突，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收 30% 的关税将对欧洲最大经济体的出口商造成 "核心打击"。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said US President Donald Trump’s threat of 30% tariffs would hit exporters in Europe’s largest economy “to the core,” if a negotiated solution in the trade conflict can’t be found in the coming weeks.】

item.title: 英伟达黄仁勋称中国军方不太可能使用美国人工智能芯片
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）表示，美国政府不必担心中国军方会利用其公司的产品来提高自己的能力。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the US government doesn’t need to be concerned that the Chinese military will use his company’s products to improve their capabilities.】

item.title: 欧盟将延长反制措施暂停期以便与美国谈判
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）表示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁对欧盟征收新的30%关税后，欧盟将把暂停对美贸易反制措施的期限延长至8月1日，以便进行进一步谈判。【原文：European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said the European Union will extend the suspension of trade countermeasures against the US until Aug. 1 to allow for further negotiations, after Donald Trump threatened a new 30% tariff rate against the bloc.】

item.title: 财政赤字担忧意外提振亚洲新兴市场债券
item.description: 担心财政赤字增加的债券投资者正在转向一个不同寻常的避风港：新兴市场。【原文：Bond investors worried about rising fiscal deficits are turning to an unusual haven: emerging markets.】

item.title: 蒂姆-库克不会很快离开，但苹果公司的大调整迫在眉睫
item.description: 虽然蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）暂时不会离职，但苹果公司首席运营官的离职只是更广泛的管理改革的开始。还有公司正在缩减 iOS 26 Liquid Glass 的改版；即将推出的设备一览；Meta 挖走了苹果公司人工智能模型的高级主管。【原文：The departure of Apple’s chief operating officer is just the beginning of a broader management overhaul — though Tim Cook is staying put for now. Also: The company is scaling back the iOS 26 Liquid Glass revamp; a look at upcoming devices; and Meta poaches Apple’s top AI models executive.】

item.title: 英国交通大臣表示，英国计划采取新措施促进电动汽车销售
item.description: 英国计划推出新的激励措施，让人们以更低的价格购买新型电动汽车，因为工党政府正试图逐步淘汰污染严重的汽车销售。【原文：The UK plans to introduce new incentives to make it cheaper for people to buy new electric vehicles as the Labour government attempts to phase out the sale of polluting cars.】

item.title: 世界线动荡让瑞士交易所头疼 3 亿美元
item.description: 罗密欧-拉切尔在 2018 年将瑞士证券交易所 SIX Group AG 的支付服务部门出售给法国公司 Worldline SA 时充满了想法。【原文：Romeo Lacher was full of ideas when he sold the payment services division of Switzerland’s stock exchange SIX Group AG to French firm Worldline SA in 2018.】

item.title: 特朗普周末关税炮火挑战市场韧性
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布从 8 月 1 日起对欧盟和墨西哥征收 30% 的关税后，对美国关税威胁越来越不敏感的金融市场将在周一开盘时面临考验。【原文：Financial markets, which have shown increasing insensitivity to tariff threats from the US, will face a test at the Monday open after President Donald Trump declared a 30% rate for the European Union and Mexico effective Aug. 1.】

item.title: 神秘期权交易让印度重要股指成为焦点
item.description: 随着印度证券监管机构加强对期权市场的审查，一些投资者将与印度基准指数挂钩的合约的神秘走势作为可疑交易活动的证据。【原文：As India’s securities regulator ramps up scrutiny of the options market, some investors are pointing to mysterious moves in contracts tied to the nation’s benchmark index as evidence of questionable trading activity.】

item.title: 习近平的价格战在中国股市引起轰动
item.description: 对于摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）和高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：For strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. as well as money managers in Hong Kong and Singapore, an opaque term has suddenly emerged as the catchphrase for deciphering Chinese policy intentions and navigating the stock market.】

item.title: 美国通胀将因更多关税转嫁而回升
item.description: 在经历了数月通胀率极低的情况后，6 月份美国消费者的物价增长可能略有加快，因为公司开始转嫁与关税相关的进口商品的较高成本。【原文：After months of seeing very little inflation, US consumers probably experienced slightly faster price growth in June as companies started to pass along the higher cost of imported merchandise associated with tariffs.】

item.title: 2021 年以来最严重的降级潮预示着痛苦
item.description: 信用评级下调越来越频繁，这是公司业绩开始恶化的最新迹象，也引发了企业债务估值是否应该如此之高的新问题。【原文：Credit rating downgrades are becoming more frequent, the latest sign that companies are starting to perform worse and raising fresh questions about whether corporate debt valuations should be as high as they are.】

item.title: 特朗普组织与罗马尼亚达成协议，扩大与巴尔干地区的联系
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普总统的家族加深与巴尔干地区的联系并寻求一系列新的对外交易，特朗普组织计划将业务扩展到罗马尼亚。【原文：The Trump Organization plans to expand to Romania, as President Donald Trump’s family deepens its ties in the Balkans and pursues a lineup of new foreign deals.】

item.title: 各国争相达成协议，特朗普在关税问题上的耐心荡然无存
item.description: 美国贸易伙伴正努力在唐纳德-特朗普总统所谓的互惠关税实施前的最后几周进行谈判，他们面对的是一位已明确表示对谈判失去耐心的领导人。【原文：US trading partners trying to navigate the final weeks of negotiations before President Donald Trump’s so-called reciprocal tariffs hit are facing a leader who has made clear he’s lost patience with talks.】

item.title: 墨西哥正在谈判避免特朗普的最新关税威胁
item.description: 墨西哥正在与美国谈判，以避免美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁从 8 月 1 日起对拉美国家征收 30% 的关税。【原文：Mexico is negotiating with the US to avoid a set of 30% tariffs that President Donald Trump has threatened to impose on the Latin American country starting on Aug. 1.】

item.title: Memecoin 平台 Pump.fun 在 12 分钟内融资 6 亿美元
item.description: 周六，一个让人们创建自己的高投机性代币的平台在 12 分钟内筹集了 6 亿美元，这也是 memecoins 持续流行的另一个标志。【原文：In another sign of the ongoing popularity of memecoins, a platform that lets people create their own highly-speculative tokens raised $600 million within 12 minutes on Saturday.】
